Instrument.name: Mars Global Surveyor Spacecraft Mars Orbiter Laser Altimeter
Instrument.description: The Mars Global Surveyor Spacecraft (MGS) Mars Orbiter Laser Altimeter (MOLA) was an instrument designed to map the topography of Mars with high precision. It used laser pulses to measure the distance between the spacecraft and the Martian surface, generating detailed 3D maps of the planet's surface features, including mountains, valleys, and impact craters. MOLA data provided crucial information on Mars' elevation, polar ice caps, and landforms, aiding in the study of the planet's geological history and helping to select future landing sites. Its measurements also contributed to understanding the planet's internal structure and atmosphere.
